name: What is the purpose of this bot?
reply: This bot was created as part of a project for the NUS Module, GEQ1917: Understanding and Critiquing Sustainability. We hope to promote and enhance the e-waste recycling process in Singapore, by making information more accessible.

name: Is there any personal data that is being tracked upon using of this bot?
reply:
For the sake of data analysis for the project, we are monitoring the total number of unique users for the bot as well as anonymous location data. We also strictly adhere to the Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA). None of the locations are tied to your user information, and the only user info that is being tracked is the Telegram Chat ID to determine unique users, which does not contain any personal information.

The source code for the bot is also fully open source, and can be found on https://github.com/dandaandaaaaaan/ewastebot

name: Upon using the various e-waste bins, will the data in my e-waste be protected?
reply: The individual e-waste recycling bin vendors only want the metals from the recycled devices, and are committed towards safe disposal of e-waste, with all data destroyed. For more information, use the /programmes command to learn more about the individual programmes.

name: What should I prepare before recycling my e-waste?
reply: In order to reduce the risk of short circuit or creation of fire hazards, do tape the ends of wires or rechargeable batteries before recycling.

name: Where can I send feedback or report technical issues?
reply: Send an email to daniel.lee.mq@u.nus.edu and we will be in touch!
